intro: Boeckeleria, commonly known as the bluebells of the genus, is a flowering plant belonging to the family Campanulaceae. It is characterized by its striking, bell-shaped blue or violet flowers that bloom in early spring. The plant typically grows in moist, woodland habitats and is native to various regions in Europe and parts of Asia. Boeckeleria species are perennial herbs with slender stems and narrow, lance-shaped leaves. Its ornamental value makes it a popular choice for gardens and natural landscapes.
